00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implement cross product of vectors.
00004 #
00005 package Parser::BOP::cross;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Promote points to vectors, if possible.
00011 #  Check that they are of length three.
00012 #
00013 sub _check {
00014   my $self = shift;
00015   my ($ltype,$rtype) = $self->promotePoints();
00016   if ($ltype->{name} eq 'Vector' && $rtype->{name} eq 'Vector') {
00017     if ($ltype->{length} == 3 && $rtype->{length} == 3 &&
00018         $ltype->{entryType}{length} == 1 && $rtype->{entryType}{length} == 1)
00019           {$self->{type} = {%{$ltype}}}
00020     elsif ($self->context->flag("allowBadOperands")) {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}}
00021     else {$self->Error("Operands of '><' must by in three-space")}
00022   }
00023   elsif ($self->context->flag("allowBadOperands")) {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}}
00024   else {$self->Error("Operands of '><' must be Vectors")}
00025 }
00026 
00027 #
00028 #  Use 'x' as cross product in perl (see Value.pm for more).
00029 #
00030 sub _eval {$_[1] x $_[2]}
00031 
00032 #
00033 #  Return the zero vector if one operand is zero.
00034 #  Factor out negatives.
00035 #
00036 sub _reduce {
00037   my $self = shift;
00038   my $reduce = $self->{equation}{context}{reduction};
00039   return $self->{lop} if $self->{lop}{isZero} && $reduce->{'0><x'};
00040   return $self->{rop} if $self->{rop}{isZero} && $reduce->{'x><0'};
00041   return $self->makeNeg($self->{lop}{op},$self->{rop}) if $self->{lop}->isNeg && $reduce->{'(-x)><y'};
00042   return $self->makeNeg($self->{lop},$self->{rop}{op}) if $self->{rop}->isNeg && $reduce->{'x><(-y)'};
00043   return $self;
00044 }
00045 
00046 $Parser::reduce->{'0><x'} = 1;
00047 $Parser::reduce->{'x><0'} = 1;
00048 $Parser::reduce->{'x><(-y)'} = 1;
00049 $Parser::reduce->{'(-x)><y'} = 1;
00050

00052 
00053 1;
